title: Fight breaks out among audience at T2 Trainspotting screening - as life imitates art during violent film
text:
A screening of Trainspotting 2 in Dorchester sparked a row among audience members Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Life appeared to imitate art at a screening of the T2 Trainspotting sequel when a fight kicked off between members of the audience. 
Punches were thrown, audience members started squaring up to one another and people started swearing as the viewing of the Danny Boyle film descended into chaos. 
The row was apparently sparked by 'an extremely loud blonde woman' continually laughing throughout the film, according to a fellow cinema-goer. 
T2 is the sequel to Boyle's gritty film Trainspotting, which explores drug taking and violence in an Edinburgh underworld and sees the original cast return. 
Daniel Smith, of Sherborne, said the woman was repeatedly asked to be quiet by people around her. 
But the situation escalated when people in the row behind her at the Odeon cinema in Dorchester started shouting and a slanging match ensued. The Odeon cinema Dorchester (Photo: Google Maps) Read More 
It appeared one of the women threw a punch and several people were being restrained as tempers flared, Somerset Live reports. 
Two men then reportedly started swearing at each other and trying to square up to one another. 
But there were several other audience members inbetween them. 
Mr Smith said the "effing and blinding" continued until one of the women shouted "if you want a fight, let's go outside". Read More Trainspotting 'drug estate' given listed status because 'banana flats' building has special architectural importance 
One dragged another by the arm and in total around five left as staff members with torches entered the screen to find out what was happening. 
Mr Smith said: "I'm not sure what was more entertaining, the film or the live action cat fight. 
"It looked like the blonde woman had had a few drinks and to be fair she was ruining it for everyone". Like us on Facebook
